ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Age in years
Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2, Daily

ElementDescription: Version/code of assessment
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: In general, how is your health?
Notes: 1 = Excellent; 2 = Very Good; 3 = Good; 4 = Fair; 5 = Poor

ElementDescription: How much does your health limit your involvement in moderate activities (e.g., moving a table, pushing vacuum cleaner...)?
Notes: 1 = Yes - Limited A Lot 2 = Yes - Limited A Little; 3 = No - Not Limited At All

ElementDescription: How much does health limit your ability to climb several flights of stair?
Notes: 1 = Yes - Limited A Lot 2 = Yes - Limited A Little; 3 = No - Not Limited At All

ElementDescription: How often in the past 4 weeks did your physical health result in accomplishing less than you would like with work or other activities?
Notes: 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: How often in the past 4 weeks did your physical health result in being limited in kind of work or other activities?
Notes: 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: How often in the past 4 weeks did your emotional problems result in accomplishing less than you would like with work or other activities?
Notes: 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: How often in the past 4 weeks did your emotional problems result in not doing work or activities as carefully as usual?
Notes: 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: How much in the past 4 weeks did pain interfere with normal work (including work outside home and housework)?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = Slightly; 3 = Moderately; 4 = Quite a bit; 5 = Extremely

ElementDescription: How often in the past 4 weeks did you feel calm and peaceful?
Notes: 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: How often in the past 4 weeks did you have a lot of energy?
Notes: 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: How often in the past 4 weeks did you feel downhearted and depressed?
Notes: 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: How often in the past 4 weeks did your physical health or emotional problems interfere with social activities (like visiting with friends...)?
Notes: 1 = All of the time; 2 = Most of the time; 3 = Some of the time; 4 = A little of the time; 5 = None of the time

ElementDescription: SF-12: Bodily pain scale: High score indicates low bodily pain.
Notes: Bodily pain scale for the MOS 12-item short-form health survey (SF-12) v2 (calc).  High score indicates low bodily pain.

ElementDescription: SF-12: General health scale: High score indicates good perception of overall health.
Notes: General health scale for the MOS 12-item short-form health survey (SF-12) v2 (calc).  High score indicates good perception of overall health.

ElementDescription: SF-12: Role emotional scale: High score indicates few (or no) limitations in usual role activities because of emotional health problems.
Notes: Role emotional scale for the MOS 12-item short-form health survey (SF-12) v2 (calc).  High score indicates few (or no) limitations in usual role activities because of emotional health problems.

ElementDescription: SF-12: Role physical scale. High score indicates few (or no) limitations in usual role activities because of physical health problems.
Notes: Role physical scale for the MOS 12-item short-form health survey (SF-12) v2 (calc).  High score indicates few (or no) limitations in usual role activities because of physical health problems.

ElementDescription: SF-12: Physical functioning scale: High score indicates few (or no) limitations in physical activities because of health problems.
Notes: Physical functioning scale for the MOS 12-item short-form health survey (SF-12) v2 (calc).  High score indicates few (or no) limitations in physical activities because of health problems.

ElementDescription: SF-12: Vitality scale: High score indicates high vitality (low energy and low fatigue).
Notes: Vitality scale for the MOS 12-item short-form health survey (SF-12) v2 (calc).  High score indicates high vitality (low energy and low fatigue).

ElementDescription: SF-12: Mental health scale: High score indicates good general mental health (psychological distress and well-being).
Notes: Mental health scale for the MOS 12-item short-form health survey (SF-12) v2 (calc).  High score indicates good general mental health (psychological distress and well-being).

ElementDescription: SF-12: Social functioning scale: High score indicates few (or no) limitations in social activities because of physical or emotional problems.
Notes: Social functioning scale for the MOS 12-item short-form health survey (SF-12) v2 (calc).  High score indicates few (or no) limitations in social activities because of physical or emotional problems.

ElementDescription: SF-12: Physical Health Summary: High score indicates good physical functioning.
Notes: Physical component summary (PCS) scale for the MOS 12-item short-form health survey (SF-12) v2 (calc).  High score indicates good physical functioning.

ElementDescription: SF-12: Mental Health Summary: High score indicates good emotional functioning.
Notes: Mental component summary scale (MCS)for the MOS 12-item short-form health survey (SF-12) v2 (calc).  High score indicates good emotional functioning.
